Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899 – 6024.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
1

(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/19/25, youth was escalated, and a staff member pushed the
youth after the youth spit on the staff member. There is a scratch
on the youth's arm from a peer from the previous day. On 1/19/25,
the youth stated he wanted to press charges against the staff
member for pushing him. The staff member admitted to pushing
the youth.
Investigation Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Therapist reported walking into the facility and
Youth A stating he wanted to press charges. Therapist stated she
was unaware of what Youth A was talking about. Therapist
reported Staff 1 told Therapist he needed a break, that Youth A
just spit on him and Staff 1 pushed Youth A. Therapist stated she
told Staff 1 to call the on-call supervisor and take a break.
Therapist described taking Youth A into the office and talking with
Youth A. Therapist reported Youth A told her Staff 1 pushed him.
Therapist denied seeing any marks or bruises on Youth A.
Therapist stated Youth A never expressed concerns regarding
Staff 1 in the past.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth A described being upset because a
youth, he could not recall who, was talking about Youth A’s mom.
Youth A stated Staff 1 was talking to Youth A then pushed Youth
A. Youth A stated he pushed Staff 1 and Staff 1 pushed Youth A
again. Youth A reported there were no other youth or staff around
when Staff 1 pushed Youth A. Youth A described falling
backwards and “bashing his head on a chair.” Youth A denied
having any marks or injuries from being pushed by Staff 1. Youth
A was asked to see his arms to see if there were any marks.
Youth A was observed to not have any marks on either arm.
Youth A reported he was in a fight with a peer earlier and may
have had a scratch. Youth A reported he could not recall if he
was seen by nursing.
On-Call Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility
on January 21, 2025. On-Call Supervisor described receiving a
phone call from Staff 1 saying Staff 1 pushed Youth A. On-Call
Supervisor reported Staff 1 stated he pushed Youth A in the heat
of the moment, took a break, was doing okay now but needed to
let On-Call Supervisor know what occurred. On-Call Supervisor
2

described talking with Therapist and reviewing video of the
incident. On-Call Supervisor stated a plan was made for Staff 1
not to be alone with Youth A and later Staff 1 was moved to a
different house to work alongside Supervisor. On-Call Supervisor
reported no youth had expressed concerns with Staff 1.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 21, 2025. Youth B reported everything being “good” at
the facility. Youth B stated he likes all the staff who work at the
house and gets along “pretty good” with the other youth at the
house. Youth B denied ever seeing any staff push a youth. Youth
B denied having any concerns about Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
21, 2025. Staff 1 described Youth A being escalated because a
peer had been talking about Youth A’s mother. Staff 1 stated
Youth A was knocking over tables, threatening Staff 1 and telling
Staff 1 he was going to spit on Staff 1. Staff 1 reported Youth A
spit on him and Staff 1 “took it too far and pushed him [Youth A]”.
Staff 1 stated, “I should have done a 1000 other things.” Staff 1
reported he pushed Youth A one time. Staff 1 denied Youth A
falling to the ground. Staff 1 stated Youth A took one step back
after being pushed but again denied Youth A falling to the ground.
Staff 1 described not following his training and that he should not
have pushed Youth A. Staff 1 stated Therapist entered the facility,
Staff 1 told Therapist he pushed Youth A then Staff 1 called On-
Call Supervisor. Staff 1 apologized to Youth A later the same
night and told Youth A he should not have pushed Youth A. Staff
1 denied ever pushing any other youth. Staff 1 stated Staff 2 was
in the sensory room with the other youth because those youth
were moved because Youth A was escalated. Staff 1 reported
Staff 2 saw him push Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed via Teams, then via telephone as
Teams kept cutting in and out on February 6, 2025. Staff 2
described Youth A being escalated so Staff 2 took the other youth
into the sensory room away from Youth A. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
stayed with Youth A in the main area of the facility to help de-
escalate Youth A. (The sensory room is next to the main area in
the facility). Staff 2 stated, “they [Youth A and Staff 1] both
shoved each other.” Staff 2 reported Staff 1 shoved Youth A
onetime with an open hand. Staff 2 stated he could not recall if
Youth A fell to the ground or lost his balance. Staff 2 reported this
was the first time ever seeing Staff 1 push any youth. Staff 2
stated he had not had any concerns with Staff 1 prior to seeing
3

Staff 1 push Youth A. Staff 2 described walking out of the sensory
room to assist once he saw Staff 1 push Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video was reviewed on 01/21/2025 while at the facility. Youth A is
seen standing in front of Staff 1 pushing Staff 1 two times. It
appears Youth A spits on Staff 1’s face. Staff 1 is seen wiping his
face with the sleeve of his right arm and pushing Youth A one time
with both hands. Youth A does not fall to the ground but is
pushed back two steps. There is not any furniture in the area and
Youth A is not seen falling to the ground.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had one disciplinary action
dated 12/31/24 for not completed an incident report on
time. Staff 1 completed the required Aegis training on
06/14/24.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Policies and
Procedures. Policy documents, Eagle Village staff are
trained in de-escalation techniques which are designed to
help the youth work through their trauma or instances
where they are triggered. De-escalation techniques include
but are not limited to: collaborative problem solving,
reminding youth of coping skills, separation from the group
or situation, use of sensory items, etc. Only those
techniques taught during Aegis training are permitted.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Policies and Procedures
Behavior Support and Management: Behavior support and
management is more than just managing the youths’
physical behavior; it involves the entire treatment process
to the end of helping the youth manage their own behavior
in a socially healthy and respectful manner. Any staff
member found using unacceptable discipline practices will
immediately be subject to disciplinary action up to
termination.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as per staff and youth
interviews and video review Staff A did push Youth A. Staff 1
admitted to pushing Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2025SIC0000192 dated 02/03/25, CAP pending
SIR 2024C0001099SI dated 2/21/24, CAP Approved 2/29/24
SIR 2024SIC0001785 dated 12/12/24, CAP Approved 1/30/25
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
